ru.jango.j0loader

Class DataLoader<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.jango.j0loader.DataLoader<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - after postprocessing of the loaded data an object of type T will be created and passed into DataLoader.LoadingListener.processFinished(Request, byte[], Object)
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageLoader, ParamedLoader

    public abstract class DataLoader<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Base abstract loader class. Capabilities:
    • load data itself (HTTP GET without sending params, file, ftp, jar - see URLConnection)
    • report into main thread by DataLoader.LoadingListener (protected post...() methods)
    • can call listeners' methods synchronously in loading thread (see setFullAsyncMode(boolean))
    • provides one Thread for asynchronous queue execution (loadInBackground(Request))
    • control thread execution (canWork(), cancelCurrent())
    • control queue execution (createQueue())

    Uses Java listeners model (classical Observer pattern) - many DataLoader.LoadingListeners could listen to one loader; and loader reports to all listeners about all events. Each listener should check itself, whether the data passed into it's methods is valid for it, or should be ignored. It could be done with help of the Request objects, witch are passed into each DataLoader.LoadingListener's methods.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  DataLoader.LoadingListener<T>
      Listener interface for loading (uploading and downloading) process.

      • addLoadingListener

        public void addLoadingListener(DataLoader.LoadingListener<T> listener)
        Adds new listener. A DataLoader.LoadingListener object should be unique - you can't add a single listener twice.
        Parameters:
        listener - new loading listener

      • removeLoadingListener

        public void removeLoadingListener(DataLoader.LoadingListener<T> listener)
        Removes a certain DataLoader.LoadingListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - loading listener to remove

      • stopWorking

        public void stopWorking()
        Attempts to stop a queue execution. It doesn't actually stops the execution - only sets an internal flag to FALSE. Various longrunning methods check this flag and stop themselves.

        Calling this method won't stop queue immediately, but all operations will die soon after it.

      • allowWorking

        public void allowWorking()
        Sets internal flag to TRUE, that indicates that queue can be executed. Method doesn't actually starts the execution (start() does), it only allows execution.

      • canWork

        public boolean canWork()
        Checks if queue execution is allowed.
        See Also:
        stopWorking(), allowWorking()

      • cancelCurrent

        public void cancelCurrent()
        Attempts to stop downloading the current queue element. It doesn't actually stops the downloading - only sets an internal flag. The downloading loop than this flag and stops itself.

        Calling this method won't stop downloading, but the operation will die soon after it.

      • isCurrentCancelled

        public boolean isCurrentCancelled()
        Checks if processing of current queue element was cancelled.
        See Also:
        cancelCurrent()

      • setFullAsyncMode

        public void setFullAsyncMode(boolean fullAsyncMode)
        By default full asynchronous mode is OFF and all DataLoader.LoadingListener's methods are called in main thread (inter-thread communication is already embed in loaders). It is very useful for example for updating interface.
        But if you don't need to switch into main thread, you can turn FullAsync mode ON and all your postprocessing logic (listener's methods) will be executed in loading thread, but that may stretch delays between executing requests (that is, loading itself). That could be useful when working for example with ContentProvider.

        Basically this mode was needed for tests:)

      • isFullAsyncMode

        public boolean isFullAsyncMode()
        Checks if in full asynchronous mode.

        public boolean isDebug()
        Check if debug logging is on.

        public void setDebug(boolean debug)
        Switches debug logging on/off. Default - OFF.

      • getLoaderThread

        protected java.lang.Thread getLoaderThread()
        Returns a Thread where the queue is executed. In subclasses this method could be overwritten to provide another thread.

      • removeFromQueue

        public void removeFromQueue(Request request)
        Removes a Request from the loading queue. If this Request is already being processed, it could be retrieved by getCurrentQueueElement() and the procession could be stopped by cancelCurrent() (stops only the current, not all queue).
        Parameters:
        request - a Request to remove

        public void start()
        Actually starts the execution of the queue in a separate Thread.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the loader to it's initial clear state:
        • stop operations by stopWorking()
        • clear queue by clearQueue()

      • createQueue

        protected Queue createQueue()
        Special method for queue configuration. By default DataLoader creates an instance of DefaultQueue, but if a queue with different logic is required, it could be substituted here.

        This method with conjunction of Queue hierarchy defines a usual Iterator pattern.
        Returns:
        loading queue instance

      • loadInBackground

        protected abstract void loadInBackground(Request request)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Does the subclass-specific loading operations - loading itself and postprocessing. It is called from a separate thread.
        Parameters:
        request - Request from the loading queue
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • doLoad

        protected byte[] doLoad(Request request,
            java.io.InputStream in)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Helper method for subclasses - actually does the loading. Also automatically calls onDownloadingUpdateProgress(Request, long, long) during the work; handles canWork() and isCurrentCancelled() flags.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onLoadingStarted

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • onUploadingUpdateProgress

        protected void onUploadingUpdateProgress(Request request,
                             long uploadedBytes,
                             long totalBytes)
        Reports to all listeners that a new chunk of data has been uploaded during processing the specified Request. It could be called with HTTP POST and GET requests while sending params.
        Parameters:
        request - Request processed now
        uploadedBytes - total bytes that have already been uploaded
        totalBytes - total bytes that should be uploaded (sum of all params sizes)
        See Also:
        isFullAsyncMode()

      • onDownloadingUpdateProgress

        protected void onDownloadingUpdateProgress(Request request,
                               long loadedBytes,
                               long totalBytes)
        Reports to all listeners that a new chunk of data has been downloaded for the specified Request.
        Parameters:
        request - Request processed now
        loadedBytes - total bytes that have already been downloaded
        totalBytes - total bytes that should be downloaded (content length)
        See Also:
        isFullAsyncMode()

      • onProcessFinished

        protected void onProcessFinished(Request request,
                     byte[] rawData,
                     T data)
        Reports to all listeners that executing of the specified Request has just successfully finished.
        Parameters:
        request - Request that had just been processed
        rawData - raw bytes of the downloaded data
        data - postprocessed loader-specific data
        See Also:
        isFullAsyncMode()

      • onProcessFailed

        Reports to all listeners that executing of the specified Request has just failed.
        Parameters:
        request - Request that had just failed
        e - raised Exception
        See Also:
        isFullAsyncMode()
